# (git 6) Analysis IV (rho)

## Summary

The population recombination rate is estimated within the [**nextflow**](https://www.nextflow.io/) script `analysis_recombination.nf` (located under `$BASE_DIR/nf/06_analysis_recombination/`), which runs on the _SNPs only_ data set.
Below is an overview of the steps involved in the analysis.
(The <span style="color:#4DAF4A">green dot</span> indicates the genotype input, <span style="color:#E41A1C">red arrows</span> depict output that is exported for further use.)

## Details of `analysis_recombination.nf`

### Data preparation

The nextflow script starts by opening the genotype data.

<div class="kclass">

<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode">#<span class="hl opt">!/</span>usr<span class="hl opt">/</span>bin<span class="hl opt">/</span>env nextflow
<span class="hl slc">// This pipeline includes the recombination anlysis</span>
<span class="hl slc">// git 6.1</span>
<span class="hl slc">// load genotypes</span>
<span class="hl kwa">Channel</span>
	.fromFilePairs<span class="hl opt">(</span><span class="hl str">&quot;../../1_genotyping/4_phased/phased_mac2.vcf.{gz,gz.tbi}&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">)</span>
	.set<span class="hl opt">{</span> vcf_ch <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

The estimation of the population recombination rate using `FastEPRR` happens in three steps.
The first step is run independently for all linkage groups, so we set up a channel for the LGs.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.2</span>
<span class="hl slc">// initialize LGs</span>
<span class="hl kwa">Channel</span>
	.from<span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl num">1</span>..24 <span class="hl opt">)</span>
	.map<span class="hl opt">{</span> it.toString<span class="hl opt">()</span>.padLeft<span class="hl opt">(</span><span class="hl num">2</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;0&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">) }</span>
	.set<span class="hl opt">{</span> lg_ch <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

To prepare the input, the genotypes are split by LG.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.3</span>
<span class="hl slc">// split genotypes by LG</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> split_allBP <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_20g2h_split_by_lg&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">),</span> vcfId<span class="hl opt">,</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> lg_ch.combine<span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf_ch <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;phased_mac2.LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> vcf_by_lg_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	module load openssl1.0.2</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	vcftools --gzvcf</span> <span class="hl ipl">${vcf[0]}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--chr LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span> <span class="hl str">\</span>
<span class="hl str">		--recode \</span>
<span class="hl str">		--stdout | bgzip  &gt; phased_mac2.LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">.vcf.gz</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

The prepared data is then fed to the first step of `FastEPRR`.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.4</span>
<span class="hl slc">// run fasteprr step 1</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> fasteprr_s1 <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_20g2h_fasteprr_s1&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">module</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;R3.5.2&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> lg <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> vcf <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> vcf_by_lg_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;step1_LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> step_1_out_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	mkdir step1_LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span>
<span class="hl str">	Rscript --vanilla \$BASE_DIR/R/fasteprr_step1.R ./</span><span class="hl ipl">${vcf}</span> <span class="hl str">step1_LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span> <span class="hl str">LG</span><span class="hl ipl">${lg}</span> <span class="hl str">50</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

Since `nextflow` manages the results of its processes in a complex file structure, we need to collect all results of step 1 and bundle them before proceeding.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.5</span>
<span class="hl slc">// collect step 1 output</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> fasteprr_s1_summary <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_loc_fasteprr_s1_summmary&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> step1 <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> step_1_out_ch.collect<span class="hl opt">()</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;step1&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> <span class="hl opt">(</span> step1_ch1<span class="hl opt">,</span> step1_ch2 <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	mkdir step1</span>
<span class="hl str">	cp step1_LG*/* step1/</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

The second step of `FastEPRR` is parallelized over an arbitrary number of sub-processes.
Here, we initialize 250 parallel processes and combine the parallelization index with the results from step 1.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.6</span>
<span class="hl slc">// initialize fasteperr subprocesses and attach them to step 1 output</span>
<span class="hl kwa">Channel</span>
	.from<span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl num">1</span>..250 <span class="hl opt">)</span>
	.map<span class="hl opt">{</span> it.toString<span class="hl opt">()</span>.padLeft<span class="hl opt">(</span><span class="hl num">3</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;0&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">) }</span>
	.combine<span class="hl opt">(</span> step1_ch1 <span class="hl opt">)</span>
	.set<span class="hl opt">{</span> step_2_run_ch <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

Taking this prepared bundle, we now can start the second step of `FastEPRR`.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.7</span>
<span class="hl slc">// run fasteprr step 2</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> fasteprr_s2 <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_long_loc_fasteprr_s2&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">tag</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;run_</span><span class="hl ipl">${idx}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">module</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;R3.5.2&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> idx <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> step1 <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> step_2_run_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> idx <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;step2_run</span><span class="hl ipl">${idx}</span><span class="hl str">&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> step_2_out_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	mkdir -p step2_run</span><span class="hl ipl">${idx}</span>
<span class="hl str">	Rscript --vanilla \$BASE_DIR/R/fasteprr_step2.R</span> <span class="hl ipl">${step1}</span> <span class="hl str">step2_run</span><span class="hl ipl">${idx} ${idx}</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

The file management of `nextflow` can be a bit complicated at times, so here duplicate the output of step 2 to later easily access the parallelization indices and the actual output.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.8</span>
<span class="hl slc">// clone step 2 output</span>
step_2_out_ch.into<span class="hl opt">{</span> step_2_indxs<span class="hl opt">;</span> step_2_files <span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

We collect both clones of the step 2 results and bundle the results in a single directory.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.9</span>
<span class="hl slc">// collect step 2 output</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> fasteprr_s2_summary <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_loc_fasteprr_s2_summmary&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">val</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> idx <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> step_2_indxs.map<span class="hl opt">{</span> it<span class="hl opt">[</span><span class="hl num">0</span><span class="hl opt">] }</span>.collect<span class="hl opt">()</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> files <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> step_2_files.map<span class="hl opt">{</span> it<span class="hl opt">[</span><span class="hl num">1</span><span class="hl opt">] }</span>.collect<span class="hl opt">()</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;step2&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> <span class="hl opt">(</span> step2_ch <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	mkdir step2</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	for k in \$( echo</span> <span class="hl ipl">${idx}</span> <span class="hl str">| sed &#39;s/</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">[//g; s/</span><span class="hl esc">\\</span><span class="hl str">]//g; s/,//g&#39;); do</span>
<span class="hl str">		cp -r step2_run\$k/* step2/</span>
<span class="hl str">	done</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

Then we feed the bundled results into the third step of `FastEPRR`.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.10</span>
<span class="hl slc">// run fasteprr step 3</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> fasteprr_s3 <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_32g4h_fasteprr_s3&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">module</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;R3.5.2&quot;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwa">set</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> step1 <span class="hl opt">),</span> <span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> step2 <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> step1_ch2.combine<span class="hl opt">(</span> step2_ch <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;step3&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> step_3_out_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	mkdir step3</span>
<span class="hl str">	Rscript --vanilla \$BASE_DIR/R/fasteprr_step3.R</span> <span class="hl ipl">${step1} ${step2}</span> <span class="hl str">step3</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>

To ease the usage of the `FastEPRR` results downstream, we reformat them and compile a tidy table.


<div class="sourceCode">
<pre class="sourceCode">
<code class="sourceCode"><span class="hl slc">// git 6.11</span>
<span class="hl slc">// reformat overall fasteprr output</span>
<span class="hl kwa">process</span> fasteprr_s3_summary <span class="hl opt">{</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">label</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;L_loc_fasteprr_s3_summmary&#39;</span>
	<span class="hl kwb">publishDir</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;../../2_analysis/fasteprr&quot;</span><span class="hl opt">,</span> mode<span class="hl opt">:</span> <span class="hl str">&#39;copy&#39;</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">input</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> step3 <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">from</span> step_3_out_ch

	<span class="hl kwb">output</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl kwc">file</span><span class="hl opt">(</span> <span class="hl str">&quot;step4/fasteprr.all.rho.txt.gz&quot;</span> <span class="hl opt">)</span> <span class="hl kwa">into</span> <span class="hl opt">(</span> step3_ch <span class="hl opt">)</span>

	<span class="hl kwb">script</span><span class="hl opt">:</span>
	<span class="hl str">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl str">	mkdir step4</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	# ------ rewriting the fasteprr output into tidy format --------</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	for k in  {01..24};do</span>
<span class="hl str">	    j=&quot;LG&quot;\$k;</span>
<span class="hl str">	    echo \$j;</span>
<span class="hl str">	    \$BASE_DIR/sh/fasteprr_trans.sh step3/chr_\$j \$j step4/fasteprr.\$j</span>
<span class="hl str">	done</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	# --------- combining all LGs into a single data set -----------</span>
<span class="hl str">	cd step4</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	head -n 1 fasteprr.LG01.rho.txt &gt; fasteprr.all.rho.txt</span>
<span class="hl str"></span>
<span class="hl str">	for k in {01..24}; do</span>
<span class="hl str">	echo &quot;LG&quot;\$k</span>
<span class="hl str">	awk &#39;NR&gt;1{print \$0}&#39; fasteprr.LG\$k.rho.txt &gt;&gt; fasteprr.all.rho.txt</span>
<span class="hl str">	done</span>
<span class="hl str">	gzip fasteprr.all.rho.txt</span>
<span class="hl str">	cd ..</span>
<span class="hl str">	&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="hl opt">}</span>
</code>
</pre>
</div>
</div>

Finally, we are done with recombination rate.

---
